result.execSummary:
The defendant Joshua A Librizzi was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Waukesha County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety.

Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by agent. 
Follow any conditions deemed appropriate by agent.

Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes: Huber with non working hours and standard release conditions, STAYED, to be used at agents discretion.

Defendant discharged from Drug Treatment Court
Sentencing hearing on November 14, 2018 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Joshua A Librizzi in court, in custody, with attorney Thomas Patrick Grieve.   Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State made by Attorney Grieve.  The defendant is voluntarily withdrawing from the program.  Court orders defendant be formally discharged from DTC. Matter to be set for sentencing by Judge Lau's staff.  Bail is revoked.

Defendant Joshua A Librizzi in court, in custody.  Andrea M Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty. Will notes that she has been in contact with Atty. Grieve and he has requested the discharge hearing be adjourned and advises the court of the status of the case.  Defendant is in agreement with the request to reschedule.  Court orders the defendant to be held in custody until the new discharge hearing set for Wednesday, November 14, 2018 at 2:00 pm.

Defendant Joshua A Librizzi in court.  Andrea M Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State motions for discharge.  Court orders defendant be held until further order of this Court. Discharge hearing scheduled for Wednesday, October 24, 2018 at 2:00 pm.  Defendant remanded into custody.

Defendant Joshua A Librizzi in court, in custody, with Attorney Amy Schulz who appears on behalf of Attorney Thomas Patrick Grieve.   Andrea M Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court denies the State's request for discharge.  Defendant is to be held in custody until placement is found.

Defendant Joshua A Librizzi in court, in custody, with attorney Thomas Patrick Grieve.   Andrea M Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Mary Haberman, from Hope Haven, appeared by phone.  Mary Haberman sworn and testified.  Attorney Will has direct examination.  Cross-examination by Attorney Grieve.  Re-direct by Attorney Will.  State maintains its motion for discharge.  Defense makes its arguments.  Defendant to be held until DTC court next Wednesday, March 28, 2018 at 2:30 p.m. in the Waukesha County Jail.  Defendant is remanded to the Sheriff's Dept.
Discharge hearing on March 22, 2018 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Joshua A Librizzi in court, in custody, with attorney Thomas Patrick Grieve.   Andrea M Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court addresses the Attorneys.  Attorney Will makes statements.  Clerk calls Hope Haven and was on hold for 24 minutes.  Clerk left a message for Hope Haven to call the court back.  Attorney Grieve calls Officer David Janisch sworn and testified.  Cross-examination by Attorney Will.  Court continues the case to 3-22-18 at 2:30 p.m.  Clerk to contact Hope Haven so someone call appear by phone or in person.
Motion hearing on March 14, 2018 at 10:00 am.
Hearing on March 14, 2018 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Joshua A Librizzi in court with attorney Thomas Patrick Grieve.  Andrea M Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State maintains motions for discharge and makes argument.  Statement made by Atty Grieve.  Statements made by Ruth Librizzi.  Defendant made statements.  Court would like to hear more information.  Court sets a hearing for March 14, 2018 from 10:00 a.m. to 11:00 a.m.  Defendant is remanded to the custody of the Sheriff.  Hearing scheduled for March 14, 2018 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Joshua A Librizzi in court.  Andrea M Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    State motions for discharge.  
Court orders defendant be held until further order of this Court. Discharge hearing scheduled for February 28, 2018.  Defendant remanded into custody.
Court approves that the defendant is to be released to his mother and will not be returning to the Jail.

Defendant Joshua A Librizzi in court, in custody, with attorney Thomas Patrick Grieve.   Kristi J Gordon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State maintains motions for discharge and makes argument.  Statement made by Atty Grieve. Statement made by Defendant's Mother. Statement made by the Defendant. Motion to Discharge is DENIED. Defendant to remain in DTC at this time. Defendant to be held until further order of the Court.

Defendant Joshua A Librizzi in court.  Andrea M Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State motions for discharge. Court orders defendant be held until further order of this Court. Discharge hearing scheduled for December 13, 2017.  Defendant remanded into custody.
**Email sent to Atty Grieve advising him of discharge hearing.**

Sentencing hearing on July 28, 2017 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Joshua A Librizzi in court with attorney Thomas Patrick Grieve.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1 with the repeater statute stricken. Court accepts plea as, knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily made. Court strikes repeater allegation. Court withholds entry of judgment as the defendant has been accepted into DTC. Court approves the Waukesha County DTC Diversion Contract and forwards the file to DTC.
